item.title: Katie add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "Still, there are times I am bewildered by each mile I have traveled, each meal I have eaten, each person I have known, each room in which I have slept. As ordinary as it all appears, there are times when it is beyond my imagination." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "One hand, five homes. A lifetime in a fist." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Katie add a quote by T.C. Boyle
item.description: "There are always surprises. Life may be inveterately grim and the surprises disproportionately unpleasant, but it would be hardly worth living if there were no exceptions, no sunny days, no acts of random kindness." -- T.C. Boyle

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description:
"When you're young, you think everything you do is disposable. You move from now to now, crumpling time up in your hands, tossing it away. You're your own speeding car. You think you can get rid of things, and people too—leave them behind. You don't yet know about the habit they have, of coming back.
Time in dreams is frozen. You can never get away from where you've been." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "This is how the girl who couldn't speak and the man who couldn't see fell in love." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Why is it we want so badly to memorialize ourselves? Even while we're still alive. We wish to assert our existence, like dogs peeing on fire hydrants." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "It is true that I do not speak as well as I can think. But that is true of most people, as nearly as I can tell." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Love was action. It came to you. It was not a choice." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Katie add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He was still too young to know that the heart's memory eliminates the bad and magnifies the good, and that thanks to this artifice we manage to endure the burden of the past." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Katie add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "She felt the abyss of disenchantment." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Katie add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "and taught him the only thing he had to learn about love: that nobody teaches life anything." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Katie add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "This soup tastes like windows" -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Katie add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Katie add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "We were together. I forget the rest." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Katie add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I sound my barbaric yawp over the rooftops of the world." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Katie add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Be curious, not judgmental." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Katie add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Whatever satisfies the soul is truth." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Katie add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "My dear, I don't give a damn." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I'd cut up my heart for you to wear if you wanted it." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Vanity was stronger than love at sixteen and there was no room in her hot heart now for anything but hate." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "When asked "What do we need to learn this for?" any high-school teacher can confidently answer that, regardless of the subject, the knowledge will come in handy once the student hits middle age and starts working crossword puzzles in order to stave off the terrible loneliness." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Katie add a quote by T. C. Boyle
item.description:
"They wore each other like a pair of socks.
From "Love of my Life" -- T. C. Boyle
